items.summary: Add a standalone, browser-runnable (no-build-step) frontend UI implemented with plain HTML5 + CSS3 (Flexbox/Grid) + Vanilla JavaScript (ES6) that can be opened directly via file:// by opening its index.html, without using any frameworks or libraries.

Implement the Login page in the standalone UI with username + password fields, a Login button, client-side validation, and dynamically displayed error/success messages. On successful validation, simulate login state in the browser (e.g., in-memory and/or localStorage) and navigate to the Dashboard view.

Implement the Dashboard page in the standalone UI with a navigation bar containing Dashboard, Invoices, GST Returns, and Logout. Show summary cards for Total Invoices, GST Payable, and Filing Status in a professional, clean card-based layout.

Implement the Invoice Management page in the standalone UI with (1) a form to add invoice details and (2) a table listing invoices. Include UI-only View and Delete buttons in each row; Delete removes the row from the UI state. View opens an in-page modal/panel or dedicated view section showing the invoice details (UI only).
Implement the GST Return page in the standalone UI with a simple form that simulates GST return filing and shows a status message after submission.

Apply a professional government/finance-style visual design across the standalone UI using a blue/white/gray color palette with responsive layout (desktop + mobile), consistent typography, spacing, and card-based UI patterns.

In the standalone script.js, implement form validation and DOM manipulation using clearly separated functions, and include fetch() calls to placeholder REST API URLs for login, invoice list/add/delete, and GST filing (handle failures gracefully and fall back to local demo state if running via file:// causes CORS/network errors).
Provide a folder structure description (as developer-facing comments in the files and/or a small README in the standalone folder) and ensure the code is clean, readable, and well-commented.
